page.title: 10Gnosall Parish News
page.content: The magazine was first produced about 16 years ago. It is printed in the Church Institute at Gnosall. The editor has 5 people to help with typing, 3 or 4 to print, 5 to collate and about 20 people help to distribute it. About 900 copies each month are published. In the magazine are articles from the Parish Church, the Methodist Church, the Catholic Church, school P.T.A.'s, the youth club, football and cricket clubs, Scouts, Guides, Young Wives, Mothers' Union, Women's Institute and most other organisations in the village. Local businesses can advertise in the magazine at a cost of ten pounds per year. Each magazine costs 10p to publish and is sold for 12p a copy. Gnosall Parish News is full of interest and information and helps to keep everyone in the community informed
